brief_description: Older adults exhibit higher morbidity and mortality from infectious diseases compared with those of the general population.
brief_title: Repeated In Vivo Stimulation of T and B Cell Responses
condition_studied: West Nile Virus vaccine efficacy in aged mice
description: Older adults exhibit higher morbidity and mortality from infectious diseases compared with those of the general population. The
endpoints: FCM, challenge, ELISA, Neutralizing titers, Passive transfer, plaque assay
hypothesis: Age-related vulnerability to WNV infection can be overcome by vaccination
objectives: Determine immune-correlates of protection for successful vaccination to prevent WNV disease
official_title: Repeated In Vivo Stimulation of T and B Cell Responses

pubmed.title: Repeated in vivo stimulation of T and B cell responses in old mice generates protective immunity against lethal West Nile virus encephalitis.

program.contract_name: Immunological basis of age-related vulnerability in biodefense and emerging infections SP2 UAz
